review: Love the gourmet burgers here and the bottomless fries. My favorite is the Royal that comes with bacon and a fried egg followed closely by the Whisky River BBQ burger. They've done a good job of utilizing the space previously occupied by the fountains and the waitstaff is very attentive.

I'd been to other Red Robin restaurants before but never enjoyed it as much as this visit. The burger I had (Burnin Love) was cooked exactly the way I like it. The chile sauce they put on it has a great kick. It was on the spicier side for those that want to know.  The fries are seasoned well and are bottomless!  I couldn't manage to finish off my first batch though.  Guac and chips weren't delicious. It was missing the lime flavor, but you can't expect much from a hamburger joint.  Service from Clarence was wonderful. My glass was always full. I did feel slightly uncomfortable when i was  greeted by about 6 or 7 people when I first walked in. A little overkill.

Red Robin is one of my wife's favorite places (for burgers) so we were delighted when one opened at the Hulen Mall.  Normally, as an insulin-dependent diabetic, I would order a salad, while my wife chowed down on the fabulous hamburgers and fries.  However, while looking at the menu during our first visit to this new Red Robin, I saw that not only could one choose the type of hamburger bun they wanted (including gluten free, onion, etc), but that they would serve any sandwich in a 'lettuce wrap'.  I thus ordered a cheeseburger in a lettuce wrap. It was wonderful! They made a 'bun' out of thick wedges of iceburg lettuce, with each side of the lettuce bun (top, bottom) being close to half an inch thick (you can easily peal off a layer or two), with the sandwich itself being served wrapped in paper (so you are not holding the lettuce). I immediately declared my intention to lunch at Red Robin every week for the foreseeable future or the rest of my life, whichever occurs first. .  Since I can't eat regular french fries, I substituted the sweet potato fries, which were excellent (I did take some Aprida insulin to cover the carbs from the sweet potatoes, since they are not carb-free by any means). Perhaps the best sweet potato fries I have ever had (I think they used sea salt, which makes a big difference).  My only complaint (hence the 4 versus 5 stars) is on behalf of my wife: proclaiming to serve 'bottomless' fries is worthless if the server does not come by the table to replenish the supply (they initially give you a small serving). When our server finally came by and was asked for more fries, it took a good five minutes for them to get to the table. I was surprised at the delay, since it was 11:30 a.m., with few people in the restaurant. My wife also said that the steak fries were overcooked, although she found a few that were 'perfect'. I did not, by the by, ask if the sweet potato fries were 'bottomless' (note that to substitute sweet potato costs $1.49 extra).  Nevertheless, a good experience (perfect, from my stand point). I will go ahead and say that, from times past, the salads are very good.

I really liked this restaurant my waiter was maybe new/young but he was nice.  My salad bowl was dirty though on the side without food so that is a big complaint I have.  I'm not a germophobe so I didn't ask for another plate or anything.

Food is very good.   Problem is the food takes forever to come out.  Took almost two hours to get in and out.  Don't come here if you're on a tight schedule.  Also don't bother specifying how you want your burgers cooked.  They are always well done.  :-(

the cheese fries have a Thousand Island dressing on top of the fries and then cheese. The salad I had what's good but my husband had there Red Robin cheeseburger and he said that it tasted like it was a frozen patty that was put on a grill.  also I had the French onion soup which had no flavor. Red Robin yuck.

I had heard somewhat of a hype about Red Robin and was excited to try it. We went in around 9 on a Thursday and the place was almost empty. From first sight it looked really clean but after sitting there for a minute you start to notice all of the debris under the neighboring empty tables.  I ordered the Bleu Ribbon burger which included bottomless fries. My friend got a turkey sandwich. The burger came out looking nothing like the glorious picture on the menu. The golden, crispy onions in the picture were mushy brownish blackish onions smeared on the bottom of my bun. There was so much thousand island on it that the bun was soggy and I didn't even see the Bleu cheese. It didn't taste terrible but I would have much rather spent $10 on a burger at Rodeo Goat across town. The fries are bottomless and they give you a handful on your plate but the server never asked us if we wanted anymore. My friend's sandwich was burned. The bread was noticeably black. I don't think I'll try this place again.
Best burger in town!!!! The prices are a tad high but sooo worth it! Many choices and salads and chicken too!  Endless fries is the best!

Just another chain, with a chain experience and atmosphere. Red Robin seems to be the same regardless where we are. Food is good, service is horrible. We went during a slow hour, and it took the poor girl 10 minutes to seat us. When we finally got seated, the table was dirty. My husband loves this place, just wish the service was better.
Great Hamburgers . My new favorite banzai burger! Our waitress was very good always had water coming and i love the endless fries.

Fries were good steak fries, eat as much as you want.  Bleu Burger was  ok.. needed more flavor...  Peartini was expensive and not as good as others I have had from different places. Kid's meals were about $5 and the chocolate milk was free refills.

Update to an earlier review: The waitress was not very knowledgeable on drinks or the menu.  In fact she told us herself she just started working here after working for another restaurant chain for years.   The chips we ordered for an appetizer were stale and they give you very little salsa and guacamole.  The chili burger was bland, and there was more bread than meat on the prime rib. And one of orders was brought out wrong after it was stressed we wanted it a certain way.   This experience really surprised us as our time here earlier was a really good one.

Went in for lunch. Understaffed and appeared no one knew what was going on. Left after 10 minutes of waiting for our drink order. To make it worse, I called back that afternoon to speak to a manager. I was put on hold for 10 minutes and a manager never even bothered to pick up. With several good hamburger places in this area, I will not bother visiting here again.

The best Red Robin in the local area! It's beautifully set up and the servers rule! He forgot to bring our onion rings, so he have them to us on the house and gave us free sweet potato fries! The bleu ribbon burger is so good it hurts!

I love this place. My boyfriend and I eat here all the time! The burgers are good, I love the endless fries and endless root beer floats! So good! The service is usually pretty good and the staff is friendly. They definitely have some unusual but good drinks as well. Totally worth the money. I highly recommend it.

Best gluten-free burger & fries anywhere! Awesome gluten-free menu on their app & they'll even bring over an iPad so you can access it through them. Lots of GF salad dressings too. Always exceptional service. We always sit on the bar side.
exchanged salads one uncooked chicken.The other brown lettuce and did not adjust the bill
I had the mushrooms n swiss and gross the mushrooms were really wear and the bun was soggy eeew  I won't pay to eat here but I'll eat it if it was cheaper nothing special Here

RedRobin continues to offer great food and beverages at reasonable prices.  We have had friendly but very slow service in past few visits but today at lunch the service was perfect.  Friendly, professional and unobtrusive.   I'd like to give special mention to redrobin.com's allergen interactive menu.  For my sons tree nut and peanut allergy it was perfect as it helped us navigate a safe dessert option, which is often very tricky.  Manager also checked on us and overall this visit was an A+.
This place has really great tasting burgers  Although my  "colossal burger" I think it's called was really tiny almost as if it were a joke. Still will be back

A gourmet burger is not a pre-frozen patty.  I was stupid enough to try the $15 crab cake burger.  Never again.  Years ago, my hubby and I loved the Red Robin in Arlington.  Times must be tough because the portions are smaller and the prices aren't worth it.  The only shining star from my experience was the bartender.  Even though I only ordered water and two meals to go, she gave me great service.

Let's talk about lunch today. We were seated, and the hostess asked us what we'd like to drink. My fiance and I ordered two plain teas, and a lemonade for our two-year-old. She told us they'd be out shortly, and that our server would be right with us. About three minutes later, the hostess is back at our table with our drinks. She drops them off (friendly) and leaves. We take a sip and realize that we had both been given sweet teas. When our server FINALLY showed up, we pointed out the error. He immediately corrected it, but with no Sweet n Low. We ask for some, and he says he'll get some, but he takes our order first. My fiance gets a burger and fries, our toddler gets mac n cheese and broccoli, and I get their Buzz Clucks and Mac n Cheese. After my fiance has finished HALF OF HIS TEA (and after being reminded) our server finally shows up with some Sweet n Low.  Our food comes out about when you would expect it to. We had no complaints about the food. Everyone has an idea as to what the food at Red Robin should look and taste like. This lived up to our expectations. There was just one issue- no silverware. No, our daughter's came with a little spoon, and my fiance had a burger, so that was't really that big of a deal. The issue was that I had mac and cheese and chicken strips tossed in buffalo sauce, and no silverware. The woman who obviously was the manager had dropped our food off, and said she'd get us silverware. She sent around ANOTHER server, who dropped off a tray with three steak knives and some napkins. She realized what was needed and said she'd go take care of it. My family began eating. I waited. Then our server shows up with a little tray of silverware, walked right past our table, and gave it to the people next to us WHO HADN'T EVEN ORDERED YET. At this point, I had waited so long I began picking at the mac and cheese with my fingers. We were FINALLY brought forks when I was halfway done with my pasta. When she dropped them off we told her I needed ranch for my chicken. I was told she'd be right back. It wasn't until after we asked our server (asking for a second time) and he deigned himself to bring it to me that I finally got ranch. My chicken was cold at this time. My fiance was so angry he went looking for the manager, who was nowhere to be found. We finished up, paid our bill, and left. It should be said that my fiance did not have his drink refreshed at all until the end of our meal when we were ready to pay. We absolutely will not be returning back to this Red Robin location, and I encourage others to stay away.

We went here for my daughter's birthday dinner today. The service went from excellent to poor. I will give the waitress a break because she was in training.  We had a group of twelve at our table. The food came out nearly on time. It was a 3.5 on a scale of 5. Just wasn't  as good as a year ago.  Kitchen Manager was outstanding. He listened to our concerns about service and food quality. I will go back to this restaurant because manager cares about his customers.

I was excited to see a red robin open up at the hulen mall. I liked the Arlington location. They say their burgers are natural and fresh. When they opened up, we would come in weekly. Then, the service went down hill. The burgers are decent. Especially the mushroom swiss. The mushrooms are delicious and garlicky. Their bottomless fries are good, but those onion rings are the best.  The shiny new toy on the block's newness wears off and eventually becomes like any other chain. Sign up for the rewards and every 10 burgers, you get 1 free.

I hate seeing all these terrible reviews, so thought I'll give them a pat on the back :) We've taken our FOUR children, ages 2-7, to this restaurant  twice in the last few months and have had no problems. Four small kids, no problems. On Friday nights, no less. That's worthy of 5 stars to me. On both occasions I got the smoke & pepper burger with garlic parm fries & a blue moon. I don't remember what everyone else got because I had my face shoved in that delicious burger. As a matter of fact we're going tonight with just our two-year-old, and while I *want* to venture out & try a new burger, I don't know that I will.  I will admit I ran out of beer & was not asked if I would like another, but because we were rangling four kids I didn't need another. The service wasn't excellent, but not bad. On both occasions our server seemed a little overwhelmed but I've been in their shoes and seeing two adults with four small children can be SCARY to a waitress. Especially when you're already busy. But they did ok :) That burger, tho.

I love Red Robin, I've been going here for years and they never dissapointed me until now. First started by my mom and I wanting to order a trio... which consists of bottomless fries, sweet potato fries and union straws. When we placed the order our waitress went on to the kitchen and not 2 minutes later the manager "don't remember her name but was working there at 12pm " came to our table and said that since this is a " Corporate " Red Robin and not a " Franchise " that we're not able to order sweet potato fries, bottomless fries and onion straws. Mind you this order is simple and we were able to order this last time we were there ( not even a month ago ). So we said alrighty we'll get the sweet potato fries with the smoked bacon sauce ( as named on the menu ) with the garlic aoli and ranch. Then I decided to order the Gourmet Burger that came with bacon, cheese and a egg and my mom ordered a chicken wrap. Now this is where I would say the fries came out before the burger and wrap but that's the thing.... we never received our sweet potato fries... kinda weird. So the sauces without the sweet potato fries came out with our food. Now I wish I would have taken a picture of the Smoked Bacon sauce because it was completely unappealing. I was too focused on eating because I was starving lol, now before we received the sauces the manager said the sauce came with a Applewood Smoked Bacon but was called Bacon aoli and didn't know why " corporate put that on there " the sauce looked nothing like the picture in the menu... like not even remotely close. The bacon was fatty and wiggly, completely drenched in grease and tasted terrible. I could feel the grease slip and slide down my throat. The fries were slightly wet and wiggly as well. Told the waitress and sure enough the manager comes back around to bring us another one. This time my mom was on and business call and I was watching the game eating my foot. Nearly jumped when I realized she was just hovering over our table holding the sauce on a tray. Didn't care to say oh.. I'm sorry I'll come back but decided to just stand there and hover over my mom and I while she was on the phone and I was eating. So there was and awkward silence while she stood there for no joke literally 5 minutes straight. And once my mom was off the phone she said, " well this is how our sauce is made and it might have a greasy texture " and assured us the bacon was cooked and that she always gets compliments on the sauce. It made me sick just looking at it, this was by far the WORST experience I've ever had at a Red Robin and will never come back to a " corporate " Red Robin ever again!

This is an update to my previous review. I received a nice email and a $15 gift card to try this location again. Once again, the service was horrible.  We never received our refill on fries. The server even asked us if we wanted more and we said yes. We still never received them. This location must be poorly managed. We have never had these problems at the Arlington location.

Ryan,Hope,Lindsey and Andre are such amazing mangers. They always make sure every customer leaves with and an amazing feeling and full tummy. I had the southern charm burger boyyy! It was delicious. I love this place every one is friendly and helpful.

The food is good... but way over priced for hamburgers ! If you wanted lemonade it was $ 4.49 for unlimited... way over priced ! Then the burger was good but I've had much better and much cheaper. To top it off they have a thing on the table where you can play games and order and pay right at the table. It does not tell you however there is a $2.00 charge for playing the games... they call it an entertainment fee !! Didn't find this out till we paid and printed out our receipt ! Won't go back !!

Service was great! Food, not so great. We ordered guacamole and salsa for appetizer and clearly it was salsa from a jug. Tiny amount of dip (equal to size of side of ranch). Then all three of us received cold food!! Usually on our weekly visit every week is just ok. We love the convenience of this place by the mall. I also don't like how they pressure you to use the automated table machine. I like old fashioned table service! I don't want to order refills and such on this machine. I think this will have to be a place we now put on the back burner.

Great burgers! I've been to many Red Robins and this location does not fall short. Hot, fresh burgers, attentive and friendly wait staff. Great experience and will keep this place in our list of regular restaurants.

Food was just ok and service was just ok. I have been twice. The first time was better than the second time. The first time a nice person bought me lunch. The second time our food took forever and came out not even hot. They were not busy and the manager knew of the issue and said it took a while bc two burgers were well done. If that's really the issue, they probably should have came out hot. Still love the bottomless fries, which is why the get two stars. Wanted to give them more but they need to get their act together overall.

I love the food and the decor is beautiful. I went here with my boyfriend for date night and we split the baked mac n cheese with clucks and a nana nana moo moo shake. It was delicious! It is very pricey and our server sent us the wrong check.. (That has happened before) but I've had good experiences here for the most part
Really good service and the burgers are amazing! Can't go wrong with bottomless fries either. The kiosk gadget is really neat in the event you want to order something quick.

We had to get dinner.  My Wife said she wanted a buger and a shake.  I personally wasn't in the mood for anything in particular.  We were going to eat Mexican food but the place was closing in less than an hour(personal rule of not going anywhere and eat with an hour left).  We had to go down the road well actually across the street for red robin.  We waited for maybe 3 minutes before being seated.  After being seated we took ten minutes to pour over the burger menu.  I ordered the turbo q and my Wife got the bacon guacamole burger with sweet potato fries.   Our burgers were decent for the most part. They were cooked well but not dry thankfully.  Our waiter Steven was cool and took good care of us. My Wife ordered a ice cream brownie I got forced into helping her with.  I'm not a fan of the brownie it was way chewy and the strawberry glaze wasn't appealing.  Also noted the restrooms were not up to par. Look we shared the place with maybe 6 people don't tell me you can't spot clean. No one eats at a restaurant for the restroom but a clean environment is appreciated.   For the first time in 5 years eating here it was okay but I wouldn't cross the road to get dinner here again if I didn't have to.

Red Robin is a pretty good burger place. I've eaten here a few times and all but once had a good experience. Burgers are pretty tasty cooked to order how you like them. Fair prices restaurant food with bottomless steak fries. Now that's a win! If you're feeling hungry...the steak fries are pretty good...you can't beat bottomless anything.

I was happy for my Fort Worth fam that they had a convenient Red Robin but this location is not up to par as the ones in Arlington or even Grapevine.  My burger was fine, well seasoned and it didn't have that sloppy look to it either. Overall I think everyone enjoyed their food but the use of electronics to call for service and pay your check is too much. What's the point of a wait staff.   I'll go back because I do like Red Robin but maybe just to this location. I will have to agree with another review the bathroom need better care. There's an old saying if the front of the house isn't clean then you should be worried about the back of the house. That's not it exactly but if the bathrooms aren't kept clean you have to wonder about the kitchen.

Had the worst experience here a few a few days ago. My husband, me, and our 2 kids went for lunch and we were treated awfully. The waitress took our drink orders and appetizer order then forgot we existed.  Someone else brought out our app 15 minutes later and realized we had no drinks...then our waitress ran over with our drinks...then our food took 20 plus more minutes in which time we all ran out of drinks and my husband had to find another person to give us a refill..then another different person brought our food and we again ran out of drinks..when she finally came back I asked for another drink..we sat around for 10 min waiting on refill and I was so mad we just paid the tab and left. Will never go back. Awful service!  Amber needs retrained!
Food was great and bottomless sweet potato fries are the best ever! The famous burger with the egg was tasty. The fries were crunchy. I'm pleased!

Good service at the bar. I ordered take out. The only problems are that it wasn't busy and it took almost half an hour to get my order, and listening to the servers talk back and forth about their personal problems. Food was good.

cons- floors are super slick! be careful. burger was ok not great especially for price fried came out cold way to expensive for what your getting pros- garlic fries are very good wait staff is good it is like a glorified Steak 'n Shake that costs way too much.

Came here for lunch with my fiancé on a whim after we planned on going to BJ's but he wanted to try this place instead.  One thing I noticed immediately was it was extremely cold inside, to the point where it made the whole experience uncomfortable. I ordered the southern charm burger as a recommendation from our server. It was too heavy with the bbq sauce and bacon and onions and mayo all on one burger, but when I had asked our server what was on it she didn't mention mayo so I guess I should have looked myself instead of taking her word. Who puts mayo and bbq both on a burger? The fries were cold, not sure if they were served that way or if it was from the environment.  Our total was $40 for the 2 of us for lunch (we each got a burger, I ordered fries and fiancé had a salad and 2 drinks)--maybe the most overpriced meal I've ever had.  This place is already mediocre but charging that much for a meal here is totally insane. I would give it 3 stars if it had reasonable prices or wait staff who knew the ingredients on the burgers they recommend.

Onion rings and steak fries are worth ordering. They came out crispy and hot. Their ranch is housemade and delicious.  My husband says we will come here once a year for the free birthday burger.  I got "the wedgie" which was a burger wrapped in lettuce. Patty was pretty dry.  Hubby got the shroom burger which was good but not worth $10+.  For good burgers we would probably go to in n out for best value and taste.

Meh. This is the general feeling I get after leaving most Red Robin restaurants. The burger was okay, but what made this experience especially mediocre was the service. We waited quite awhile just to put in our drink orders, which is always a bad sign. Our appetizer was brought out after our main order (which was 86-ed off of our bill with many apologies from the manager(??) which I saw her do many times throughout our visit (another bad sign). "Mozarella" sticks were revolting. Our tea was old and not sweet enough (is Texas even still considered a part of "The South" anymore? This seems to be a trend...). All in all I was left with...meh.

I've never eaten at Red Robin, but after so many people telling me to go, I finally decided to try it.  I don't get the hype. I can honestly say I'll never go back. It smelled like the inside of a gym bag that had sweaty clothes sitting in it, and then one day, you open the gym bag and you're like "WHOA." Way too cold. Was literally freezing my butt off, and for all the hype I hear about their burgers, was not impressed at all. The best part of my meal was the broccoli I got as a substitute for the fries.  Our waitress was very quiet and made it seem like we we're inconveniencing her...
Great service, awesome management. Burgers were a little smaller than they have been in he past but still taste great! The fries were top notch and make sure to get that camp fire sauce too it's lit!

Our group of six went in for lunch on a Monday. The food was ok, but way overpriced. Just a basic cheeseburger and fries was $10. Most of the specialty burgers were in the $12-14 range. My wife and I both got a burger and were surprised by how small the patties were given how expensive they are. Unfortunately the service wasn't that great either. The place didn't seem very busy, but our server rarely checked on us and one member of our party had to get a to-go box for herself after our server disappeared. Definitely not worth it.

The food was great but the service was horrible! The day started just fine. We received our first order of drinks very quickly and we're able to order right after. We drank our drinks (diet coke and sweet tea) pretty quickly and had to wait over 10 minutes to get a refill. Little did we know that was going to be the last refill we would receive during the entire hour we were there. I ordered the Keep it Simple burger with a side of coleslaw and garlic and herbs fries and my boyfriend order the A1 Peppercorn burger with bottomless regular fries. When we receive our meal my boyfriends order was exactly what he wanted. Mine on the other hand was completely wrong. The burger was supposed to have a slight red Center and it did not. I also was given regular fries instead of the coleslaw and garlic and herb fries. When I told the hostess, not our waitress because she only came to our table three times, that my sides were missing/wrong she went to get the correct sides. I also wanted to ask for a side of ranch but did not due to the attitude i was given by the lady that dropped off the correct sides. Our waitress never came to apologize or ask if we needed anything else. Based on this experience I do not believe I will be returning to the location.

Our hostess was very friendly and helpful. This was our first visit so she explained the menu and some of the options. Right after we were sat I went to the restroom. When I walked in I almost ran over a girl who was bent over just inside the door. She was picking up trash that was all over the bathroom floor (dirty papertowels). She picked them up, threw them in the trash and then walked out of the bathroom without washing her hands!!!! When I got out of the bathroom there she was serving food to tables near us!! I told the hostess about it and she didn't seem concerned one bit. I really wanted to cancel our food and leave but my kids convinced me to stay. The food was not good at all. Bland, greasy and overpriced for the portions and quality  we received. I would choose any restaurant, fast food or dine in, over this place any day!

In all the years that I've eaten at Red Robin's I have never had good service. That is until today. Erica (2/17/2017) my server in the bar area was friendly, knowledgeable and professional. Most times the food is wonderful and service is terrible. My food today (burger and fries) was okay...not as good as it normally is... but the service was great.  Thanks so much.  Finally good service at Red Robin....

This was only my second time to eat here and would have never gone back if the first time had been anything like last nites "Birthday Dinner". First they were not busy and waited at least 5 min. for someone to come to the front to seat us. After being seated we waited about 13 to 15 min on drink order which the soda was flat! We ordered 2 appetizers and waited about 15 to 20 minutes for them only to notice they were swimming in the nastiest brown (promise no exaggeration literally brown) grease which was so burnt you could taste it. Told waitress and she did take them of the ticket but told us that the pickles were the worst she had ever eaten! When we finally got the food it was cold! They seriously need some help! If they operate like this everyday they wont last long! that was my last time for sure! Be warned don't go to Hulen store!!!
Well ran restaurant with good food. Service was above average, I would compare it to an upscale Chili's. All around good experience

Bad burgers & slow service. How can a place that focuses on burgers not know how to make a good one? They tasted like they came off of a conveyer belt which is not what you expect when you pay $12+ for a gourmet burger. I got the Red Robin Classic & hubby got the PepperJack. Both were crappy. Won't be back!

This place has amazingly good burgers. If you haven't tried you must. They have all kinds of burgers (cooked to order) even one with an egg on it. The have vegetarian style as well. The burgers have so much flavor.  The only problem is the servers... it takes awhile for you to get served even when there not busy, but once you do, it is awesome.

A decent gourmet burger chain. There are definitely better gourmet burger places out there, but it's nice to have a Red Robin nearby. + BOTTOMLESS FRIES Their fries are flat and thick (not the usual shape). Pretty good and goes really well with their honey mustard sauce (love it!) If you're hungry, make sure to ask your waiter for a basket of fries to start with while waiting for your burger.  + BLAZIN' LOVE This is my favorite burger here. I feel as though some of the burgers here are a bit dry, but the salsa in this one makes it nice and juicy. The burger itself isn't TOO spicy (in my opinion), but the pepper on top can be really spicy so be careful! + PRIME RIB DIP Tried it for the first time here. Really good! The prime Rib is very tender and the baguette is really really soft. The only downfall is that it's a bit pricey.. $14.99. (Comes with a small side of Cole slaw and bottomless fries)
Horrible service had to ask for waiter just to get drinks and still wait to order at this point thinking about walking out

The service was great, the food was good and the restaurant wasn't that busy for a Friday afternoon. I was satisfied with my guacamole bacon burger but my fries were just okay. Adding the seasoning that's on the table makes it wayyy more enjoyable though.  I love that they have balloons for the kiddos to take and enjoy, along with providing crayons and a coloring sheet. It really makes a difference when kids can be occupied by something other than the people behind us.  Being the second time I've been to this location and the third time I've actually dined at this chain, I would definitely return if I have a hankering for a yummy burger and endless fries.

I have been disappointed the last three times I came here, although I was immensely impressed only a year or so ago. This time I ordered an A1 burger cooked medium with salad instead of fries..homemade ranch dressing. This is probably the same dressing I had on my salad entree last time which ruined it - tasty but so watery that it just dissipates on the salad. My burger this time was definitely over done. I ordered medium which it was, but crispy on the outside & really dried out. There was not enough A1 sauce to make up for the dryness, so I was disappointed this time as well. I did not complain as we were rather in a hurry. On the plus side, our waiter was wonderful :-).

Took my brother in law for his birthday, and had maybe one of our worst experiences ever. The server was a really nice guy, but our order was so screwed up there was no fixing it, and nobody really tried.  They brought the wrong food to two different people, corrected both of the orders but were wrong again, did nothing for the birthday, would not honor the birthday burger coupon until the next day, and did nothing for the trouble of a bad meal and multiple mistakes that out the table eating at two different times. To make things worse, the fact that two of the meals went uneaten because they were bad didn't seem to affect anyone at all. I like the concept of all you can eat fries, but it's be better if they didn't give them out one fry at a time. I ordered the simple chicken sandwich, and the second time they brought it out they at least got the right sandwich, they just made it wrong and then the sandwich itself was very dry. I can't complain that it wasn't hot- it should be considering the remake put me 20 minutes behind the table- but it was not very good, the chicken was dry and rough and the bread was not good.  Hard to give a recommendation for this place after this visit. Definitely not for s birthday dinner.
Every burger I've had here are great. The staff is always pleasant. Cook to order burgers. Try the Onion Straws for an appetizer or with your meal!
I got a black and bleu and its was delicious. It was cooked perfectly and worth the money!
If "in-n-out" burger had an aunt that thought she was too good, her name would be Red Robin.

I'm one of the first to tell someone that I'm not a fan of big chains. I prefer the mom-and-pop locales, but this time I'm going to give kudos to Red Robin for their choices.  When a person is trying to lose weight and get healthy, it's a struggle to find something worthy to eat at a restaurant. You get tired of the traditional chicken breast and side salad. Red Robin must have heard me moaning, though, because they stepped up. I adore burgers. I mean, I can make a great burger, so I know what a great burger should taste like. I'm a harsh critic, too, when it comes to burgers because come on--it's so basic. The meat should be the showcase of a burger. I can't stand a wimpy, little piece of dried up meat that's lost beneath a stack of add-ons and a bun that's six times as large as the meat itself. (That's for another review I still have to do.) I say all this as a preface to this: try the Wedgie Burger from Red Robin. When I perused the menu looking for something to eat at a burger place while still adhering to my low carb diet, I can tell you that I wasn't optimistic. My face told a story of disappointment mixed with sadness at not being able to savor the Fiery Ghost Tavern Double or gobble down a Whiskey River BBQ burger. But before I closed the menu and gave up my appetite to a side salad with dressing on the side of wet lettuce and unripened tomatoes, I spotted something--The Wedgie Burger. What was this? A burger stacked with bacon, tomato, guac and wrapped with lettuce. Hmmm. My interest was piqued. At least it's a burger, I thought, so I ordered it, but frankly, I didn't expect to like it. There's something that comes over someone who has been deprived of carbs from yeasty bread and cakes and cookies and rice and noodles and STOP! That something is an appreciation for "other" foods from the "other" food groups. After one bite of the Wedgie Burger, I was a fan of lettuce because it helped to keep my juicy, hot, delicious hunk of beef from burning my hands! Wow! I truly enjoyed every bite of my Wedgie Burger. The meat was the star of the show. Not the fancy toppings or the exclusive black sesame seed bun made from gluten-free flour ground in a rain forest by indigenous people. The MEAT earned top billing! YAY for cattle! Leaving a restaurant satisfied is what every eating establishment should want from its customers, and this lady did just that! I'll be back when I have a hankering for some protein lovin'. Anyway, that's my side of the menu! :)

I arrived at Red Robin on Sunday like at 4:45 pm. It was easy to get a table and it was pretty crowded. Our waitress was incredibly nice. Our appetizers came out swiflty. My burger was seasoned well, fresh and just the right size! The steak fries were just the right amount too! If you want, you can get more fries at no charge and can get try their garlic fries too!

Let's cut to the chase, here.................... Hot, Thick-Cut, Fresh, Golden, Steak Fries!    Unlimited............Hot, Thick-Cut, Fresh, Golden, Steak Fries!  These fries are my favorite thing on the menu!    All I can say is: Thank You Red Robin Gourmet Burgers for the Hot, Thick-Cut, Fresh, Golden, Steak Fries....NO the Unlimited.......Hot, Thick-Cut, Fresh, Golden, Steak Fries!!!!! Now that that tid-bit of tastiness has been addressed, we can chat about the variety of Burgers, the glorious Grilled Cheese (4 different cheeses) Sandwich, the Cod and Chips......and what do Americans call these so called "chips"?............That's Right: we know them as Hot, Thick-Cut, Fresh, Golden, Steak Fries!  But not just any Steak Fries..........Unlimited.......Hot, Thick-Cut, Fresh, Golden, Steak Fries!  What can I say The Steak Fries are my Favorite unless we are discussing RR's VooDoo Fries...Famous Red Robin Steak Fries topped with queso, bacon crumbles, fried jalapeño coins and a drizzle of Fiery Ghost® Pepper Sauce. Served with a side of ranch or Fiery Ghost Pepper Sauce. OMG!!!!  (Sorry, but I really like these 'tators) If your sign up for a free membership (Red Robin Royalty) you get special pricing on certain items, free burgers, discounts etc... it really kinda cool....and it's Free.  Red Robin Gourmet Burgers is a nice restaurant for you and your family to come and have a filling meal. Burgers are good, entrees are tasty, decor is pleasant, staff is friendly and the Steak Fries...correction, the Unlimited Steak Fries....are filling!    RRGB receives a solid 3 Star Rating.  Happy Eating Y'all!

Ate here instead of BJs Amazing Bleu Cheese burger with all you can eat fries!! Service was not all that, but the food was fresh and good. It came out hot and nicely prepared. I'll return for sure!! Waitress might have been having a bad day. Haven't we all had those? Thanks for making room for us and our baby with the stroller!! Your food is Excellent!

This was my first time at Red Robin for Thursday night dinner and I really enjoyed it.  The restaurant was not crowded so we were able to order our food and have everything come out timely. We had the Guac burger; Chili Chili Cheeseburger and the Searious Salmon. The Freckled Lemonade was delicious. We barely got through one refill of the bottomless fries. Everything was cooked perfectly. I will definitely be a Red Robin regular.

We walked in to an empty hostess stand.  After about 10 mins we were finally approached and seated.  However, we sat at our table for 20 mins and saw 3 diff servers and the manager walk around us without stopping at our table.  We never even were asked what we wanted to drink, so we left and went to BJ's.  BJ's was packed but we were acknowledged there and got quick service.  Dont waste your time here at this location...go elsewhere.

I just saw the unthinkable a young lady walking with 2 beers and she was smelling it with her nose down deep in the cups. (Can somebody please tell me can you really determine what kind of beer it is by smelling it(my answer is NO) just go and let the bartender remake them that would be the best thing to do. Can somebody please tell me your take on this situation PLEASE
